oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of three U.S. Army soldiers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Three enlisted men pose for a studio portrait. Fred Abel sits in center and two stand behind him. All are in uniform. Two wear the 81st (Wild Cat) Division shoulder patch and all wear the overseas cap. The others are identified as Henry Fuller and Albert Vail. Fred Abel served in Co. F, 322nd Inf. Regt., 81st Div., which trained at Camp Jackson, South Carolina, and was held in reserve at the 2nd Battles of the Somme. The Abel family were lifelong Rhea County, Tennessee, farmers.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Fuller, Henry; Vail, Albert; Abel, Fred
